alert.note: Alert for Northeast Suffolk; Southeast Suffolk (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Warning issued December 17 at 2:35PM EST until December 18 at 6:00PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...1 1/2 to 2 1/2 ft of inundation above ground level is likely in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline with the Monday afternoon high tide. There is a low probability of locally 3 ft of inundation above ground level. Up to 1 ft inundation above ground level is possible with the Sunday Night high tide. * WHERE...Northeast Suffolk and Southeast Suffolk Counties. * WHEN...From 11 PM Sunday to 6 PM EST Monday. Minor flooding possible with tonight`s high tide. Widespread moderate flooding is expected with the Monday afternoon high tide, with a low probability for localized major flooding. * COASTAL FLOOD IMPACTS...Widespread flooding (up to 2 1/2 ft of inundation above ground level) of vulnerable areas is expected near the waterfront and shoreline, including roads, parking lots, parks, lawns, and homes and businesses with basements near the waterfront. Numerous road closures are likely, and vehicles parked in vulnerable areas near the waterfront will likely become flooded. Flooding will also extend inland from the waterfront along tidal rivers and bays. South facing shorelines of the north fork and areas around the entrance to Peconic River will be the most susceptible. * SHORELINE IMPACTS...Large breaking waves along the ocean beach front of 12 to 16 ft will result in widespread beach flooding and dune erosion Monday morning into afternoon. Scattered overwashes are likely where dune structures are compromised, causing flooding of roadways and vulnerable structures behind them. For Orient Point, 4 to 8 ft breaking waves during the time of high tide Monday afternoon will likely result in beach erosion, minor damage to shorefront structures and flooding of shorefront roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Peak surge of 3 1/2 to 5 ft will likely be between high tidal cycles Monday morning. The timing of windshift late Monday morning into early Monday afternoon will be critical to the potential for major flood thresholds to be reached or exceeded. Residents of vulnerable coastal locales should prepare for the potential of major flooding (3 ft of inundation above ground level) late Monday morning into Monday afternoon. In addition, heavy rainfall and/or runoff coinciding with tonight and Monday afternoon high tides will exacerbate street and property flooding issues along the coast and tidally affected rivers, particularly the Peconic River. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. PECONIC RIVER AT RIVERHEAD NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 5.7 FT, MODERATE 6.4 FT, MAJOR 7.2 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 2.3 FT, MODERATE 3.0 FT, MAJOR 3.8 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 17/03 PM 3.9/ 4.4 0.5/ 1.0 0.7/ 1.1 1 NONE 18/04 AM 4.7/ 5.2 1.3/ 1.8 1.6/ 2.0 2-3 NONE 18/04 PM 6.2/ 6.8 2.8/ 3.4 3.2/ 3.7 2 MODERATE 19/05 AM 2.3/ 2.8 -1.1/-0.6 -0.9/-0.4 0-1 NONE 19/05 PM 2.6/ 3.1 -0.9/-0.4 -0.2/ 0.2 1 NONE 20/05 AM 3.1/ 3.6 -0.3/ 0.2 -0.2/ 0.3 1 NONE ORIENT HARBOR AT ORIENT POINT NY MLLW CATEGORIES - info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth.
